qas.question: What artist issued the album known as "the first true Adult Contemporary album of the decade"?
In what year was the album Cry Like a Rainstorm, Howl Like the Wind released?
What male singer featured on several songs from Cry Like a Rainstorm, Howl Like the Wind?
What certification did Cry Like a Rainstorm, Howl Like the Wind receive?
Along with "Don't Know Much," what single won a Grammy?

context: In <a1_0>1989<a1_0/>, <a0_0>Linda Ronstadt<a0_0/> released Cry Like a Rainstorm, Howl Like the Wind, described by critics as "the first true Adult Contemporary album of the decade", featuring American soul singer <a2_0>Aaron Neville<a2_0/> on several of the twelve tracks. The album was certified <a3_0>Triple Platinum<a3_0/> in the United States alone and became a major success throughout the globe. The Grammy Award-winning singles, "Don't Know Much" and <a4_0>"All My Life"<a4_0/>, were both long-running #1 Adult Contemporary hits. Several additional singles from the disc made the AC Top 10 as well. The album won over many critics in the need to define AC, and appeared to change the tolerance and acceptance of AC music into mainstream day to day radio play.
